description: Integers connected with coefficients in expansion of Weierstrass P-function.
references: N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: L. Carlitz, The coefficients of the lemniscate function, Math. Comp., 16 (1962), 475-478.

A. Hurwitz, Über die Entwicklungskoeffizienten der lemniskatischen Funktionen, Math. Ann., 51 (1899), 196-226; Mathematische Werke. Vols. 1 and 2, Birkhaeuser, Basel, 1962-1963, see Vol. 2, No. LXVII.

A. Hurwitz, Über die Entwicklungskoeffizienten der lemniskatischen Funktionen, Math. Ann., 51 (1899), 196-226; Mathematische Werke. Vols. 1 and 2, Birkhaeuser, Basel, 1962-1963, see Vol. 2, No. LXVII. [Annotated scanned copy]
formula: a(n) = A002306(n) / A047817(n) - 1/2 - sum(chi(p)^(4*n / (p-1))/p) where the sum is over primes p of the form 4k+1 such that p-1 divides 4*n and the numbers chi(p) are given by A002172. The resulting a(n) is an integer despite all the rationals. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Aug 17 2014
mathematica: max = 14; chi[p_] := -Sum[JacobiSymbol[x^3-x, p], {x, 0, p-1}]; p[z_] := WeierstrassP[z, {4, 0}]; se = Series[p[z]-1/z^2-Sum[2^(4*n)*h[n]*z^(4*n-2)/(4*n*(4*n-2)!), {n, 1, max+5}], {z, 0, 4*(max+5)}] // Normal; A002306 = Array[h, max+5] /. SolveAlways[se == 0, z][[1]] // Numerator; d[1] = 1/10; d[n_] := d[n] = (3/(2*n-3)/(16*n^2-1))*Sum[(4*k-1)*(4*n-4*k-1)*Binomial[4*n, 4*k]*d[k]*d[n-k], {k, 1, n-1}]; A047817 = Denominator[Table[d[n], {n, 1, max+5}]]; a[n_] := A002306[[n]]/A047817[[n]]-1/2-Sum[chi[p]^(4*n/(p-1))/p, {p, Select[Prime /@ Range[max+5], Mod[#, 4] == 1 && Divisible[4n, #-1]&]}]; Table[a[n], {n, 2, max}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 11 2014 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: More terms from Pab Ter (pabrlos(AT)yahoo.com), May 07 2004
